events.name: The Official Part
events.description:
Speeches by the President and by the chairman of the student union, an invited lecture by Professor Karsten Arnbjerg Nielsen, DTU Environment, and academic awards. There will be music by the Danish composer Carl Nielsen celebrating the 150 years since his birth.

There is free access but a limited number of seats are available (the doors will be closed at 16:50 or earlier if the Hall is full).

Headsets are available (free of charge).

events.name: DJ
events.description: There is a DJ playing in the Sports Hall. Come and enjoy the music!

events.name: Les Lanciers
events.description:
Les Lanciers is danced several times during the evening, both in the Hall and in the Tent.

Les Lanciers is a Square, or a Quadrille, which is the term for a set dance performed by four couples. It is a composite dance made up of five figures of tours, each performed four times so that all couples will dance the lead part. We find Les Lanciers in many variants in several countries, though its popularity waned at the beginning of the twentieth century. It has survived as a popular dance only in Denmark, where it has now been danced in an unbroken tradition of almost 140 years, with its own distinctive music and choreography.

In Denmark, Les Lanciers is danced at court, at many university and school graduations, and at countless private functions. Les Lanciers is also taught in most Danish high schools.

The five tours of the Danish dance are: La Dorset, La Victoria, Les Moulinets, Les Visites, Les Lanciers.

events.name: Les Lanciers
events.description:

The five tours of the Danish dance are: La Dorset, La Victoria, Les Moulinets, Les Visites, Les Lanciers. 

Introductory dance classes are available before the Commemoration Party, if Les Lanciers is a new acquaintance or if you just like to refresh your steps.
Classes (in English) in Les Lanciers in the Oticon Hall Tuesday May 6th (at 16.30) and Thursday May 8th (at 17.15). Free access.

events.name: Hej Matematik
events.description:
Hej Matematik (literally 'Hi Mathematics' and also the title of a Danish primary school math book) is a Danish pop band, consisting of the Aqua-member Søren Rasted and his nephew Nicolaj Rasted. On live shows, they are accompanied by Nikolaj Teinvig on guitar, Nicholas Findsen on bass, Mads Storm on keyboards and Peter Düring on drums.

Hej Matematik has done well on the Danish charts. Their debut album was Vi burde ses noget mere. The single 'Walkmand' won the Danish 'Hit of the Year' at Zulu Awards 2009 — an annual award-ceremony held by Denmark's largest commercial television station TV 2. after the song made it to #3 in the Danish Singles Chart. The 11-track album was released in a special edition that included 'Walkmand' as a 12th track as an additional bonus.

Hej Matematik's release of 'Party i provinsen', the lead single of their second album, reached #2 in the Danish Singles Chart. The album Alt går op i 6 was released in Denmark on 25 January 2010.

events.name: Blå Mandag Jazzband
events.description:
Blå Mandag is the name of a seven membered Jazzband, who has played together for 28 years. We sing and play to please others, and we, ourselves, enjoy it very much.

We love making jokes while playing, and having played together for many years, we think we are rather good at making old, funny and traditional New Orleans Jazz, which is easy to dance to.

Our motto is: 'We are there for you', so our most distinguished purpose is. 'To play in the honour of our audience and guests' so they will have a tremendous experience.

events.description: There is a DJ playing in the Oticon Hall. Come and enjoy the music!

events.name: Scarlet Pleasure
events.description: Scarlet Pleasure is a Danish R&B, soul, funk and pop musical trio made up of Emil Goll as lead vocals, Alexander Malone on bass and Joachim Dencker on drums. The formative years of the all-Danish trio was in New York City. They released 22 September, 2014 their EP 'Mirage' on 22 September 2014 charting in Tracklisten, the official Danish Albums Chart. The single 'Windy' was prereleased in February 2014 and was chosen as P3s Uundgåelige for a week. It was followed by 'Under the Palm Trees'. The band is signed to Copenhagen Records.

events.name: DJ
events.description: There is a DJ playing in the Oticon Hall. Come and enjoy the music!

events.name: Svenstrup og Vendelboe
events.description:
Svenstrup & Vendelboe is an electro / dance / house producer team from Denmark, consisting of Kasper Svenstrup and Thomas Vendelboe.

Svenstrup and Vendelboe, produced music together for several years under various names. But in 2007 they decided to focus entirely on the commercial house scene under the name Svenstrup & Vendelboe. They became famous for the single 'I Nat' with singer Karen. But their big breakthrough came with their remix of Medina's single 'Kun for mig' winning two Danish DeeJay Awards in 2010 for their mix of the song. In 2011, they also released 'Dybt vand featuring Danish singer Nadia Malm on vocals. They have remixed hits by Robyn, Basim, Burhan G, Brinck, Emma, Medina, Outlandish and many others.
